text:
Keep:
> *Aunt Moritz*  [10:29 AM]
> I would recommend to ignore the change to initial amount as of round zero and the change to holding fees rate fields.
> Those were added because initially we thought people primarily care about tracking their effective amount as if holding fees were already deducted. Based on user feedback this does not actually seem to be the case, what people usually want to track is:
> 1. The actual amounts of holdings based on the amount when they were created ignoring any holding fees.
> 2. See holding fees when they are actually charged.
> 3. Maybe in some cases the accrued but not yet charged holding fees.

user_profile.real_name: Digital Asset Support for GSF Operations
user_profile.name: wayne.collier

elements.text:
[10:29 AM]
I would recommend to ignore the change to initial amount as of round zero and the change to holding fees rate fields.
Those were added because initially we thought people primarily care about tracking their effective amount as if holding fees were already deducted. Based on user feedback this does not actually seem to be the case, what people usually want to track is:
The actual amounts of holdings based on the amount when they were created ignoring any holding fees.
See holding fees when they are actually charged.
Maybe in some cases the accrued but not yet charged holding fees.

text:
ENABLING FEATURED APPLICATION MARKERS

<https://github.com/global-synchronizer-foundation/cips/blob/main/cip-0047/cip-0047.md|CIP-0047> introduced the concept of Featured application activity markers.  The Splice team completed an implementation of this concept as part of Splice 0.4.0.  This implementation included changes to the Daml models.

This change may impact any application that aas implemented its own new Daml models with dependencies on the `splice-amulet` DAR package.

The Super Validators will begin to adopt the new CIP-0045 Daml model changes, and enable Featured Application Activity Markers, on the following schedule:

```DevNet
	Daml models effective: Tuesday, June 10th
	Featured App Markers enabled at CIP default value of $1: Tuesday, July 1st

TestNet
	Daml models effective: Tuesday, June 24th
	Featured App Markers enabled at CIP default value of $1: Tuesday, July 15th

MainNet
	Daml models effective: Tuesday, July 8th
	Featured App Markers enabled at CIP default value of $1: Tuesday, July 29th```

user_profile.real_name: Digital Asset Support for GSF Operations
user_profile.name: wayne.collier

text:
Hello Fellow App Devs, <http://syncinsights.io|syncinsights.io> is available for those who want to keep tabs on Canton network activity. It is not just a dashboarding tool, but a full self-service proactive analytics experience.

• *Self-Service*: use natural language to access data ad-hoc for exploratory purposes and/or or create custom dashboards. Also create custom columns of data using standard functions as well as more advanced window functions.
• *Proactive*: the natural language interface can also be used to initiate AI workers for 1) real-time data monitoring or 2) automated report analysis, where a notification with a data payload is delivered.
The app leverages <http://Chata.ai|Chata.ai> underlying technology which does not hallucinate (no LLMs needed) and infers on CPU (no expensive GPU costs).  The technology can be used with structured data so if there are other app devs out there who may want to collaborate, please let us know.  Our core capabilities are definitely in the data & AI space and would be great to team up with many of you with deep DeFi and Web3 experience/capabilities.

Please DM me if any of the above is interesting

• <https://github.com/digital-asset/daml/issues/21329>
• <https://github.com/digital-asset/daml/pull/21330>
